page.title: 17HOUSING
page.content: Much of the{housing}in the Hoyland area is council owned and of the semi-detached type.The bulk of the privately owned housing falls into the Â£10,000 to Â£30,000 price bracket which ranges from terraced housing to detached properties.There is a new development of housing in Elsecar which contrasts with{Reform Row,}built in 1837 to house miners working in the local colliery.A programme of renovation has been undertaken by the council on a large number of their properties to modernise them and make them habitable well into the next century.There is a history of mining subsidence which affects some of the houses in Hoyland and all new properties are built on a concrete "raft" as a precaution against land movement.
